rationale: This species has a wide enough distribution, with only localised threats, to qualify as Least Concern. It has also been assessed regionally as Least Concern for western Africa. In central Africa, Fundulopanchax sjoestedti is known from fewer than 5 localities. The species is threatened by the oil palm plantations in the region. Both the EOO and AOO qualify for the Endangered status.
assessor: Lalèyè, P., Moelants, T. & Olaosebikan, B.D.
evaluator: Snoeks, J., Tweddle, D., Getahun, A., Lalèyè, P., Paugy, D., Zaiss, R., Fishar, M.R.A & Brooks, E.
